intro: Cerastium maximum lusus angustifolium, commonly known as narrowleaf mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant features small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring, often in clusters at the ends of stems. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, adapted to thrive in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks, where it contributes to the local flora with its delicate appearance.
